title: Iran Protests Are Fueled in Part by Kurdish Anger
description: The protests that have swept Iran following the death of a woman in police custody have been especially intense in the country’s minority Kurdish population.

title: Russia Begins Mobilizing Ukrainians to Fight Against Their Own Country
description: Panic and fear flooded the occupied territories as Russian forces rounded up men to fight and forced residents to vote in a staged referendum on joining Russia, Ukrainian officials and rights groups said.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Protests Grow in Iran
description: Plus anger builds in Japan over Shinzo Abe’s state funeral and Russia tries to conscript Ukrainians.

title: Two Americans return home months after being captured fighting in Ukraine.
Roger Waters Concert in Poland Called Off After Ukraine Views Prompt Anger
description: In online exchanges with Ukraines first lady, the Pink Floyd co-founder said Ukraine should seek peace with Russia and blamed the United States for encouraging the conflict.

title: The U.S. says it has warned Russia of ‘catastrophic consequences’ if it uses nuclear weapons in Ukraine.
Giorgia Meloni’s Adoption Views Worry Gay Parents in Italy
description: In her election campaign, Giorgia Meloni pledged to oppose surrogacy and adoption by gay couples.

title: Ukraine Warns of Growing Attacks by Drones Iran Has Supplied to Russia
description: As Moscow finds itself isolated internationally, and as its arsenal has been depleted during its monthslong campaign in Ukraine, it has turned for military support to countries including Iran.

title: In a U.N. speech, Russia’s foreign minister says ‘the future of the world order’ is at stake.
Soviet Monuments Become Latest Target of Backlash Against War in Ukraine
description: Across Eastern and Central Europe, statues honoring Soviet troops for their role in defeating the Nazis in World War II have in recent weeks come down or been slated for demolition.

title: Olaf Scholz of Germany Won’t Send Battle Tanks to Ukraine
description: Military assistance to Kyiv has become something of a litmus test of Olaf Scholz’s ability to lead Europe through its most significant security crisis since World War II.

title: In Italy’s Election, Politicians Use TikTok to Seek Votes
description: Lawmakers set up TikTok accounts to try to reach undecided voters before Sunday’s elections. Hilarity ensued.

title: The Morning: The back story of the migrant buses
description: Republican governors’ immigration stunts are actually helping some migrants.

title: Live Updates: Italy Votes in Pivotal Election for Europe
description: Opinion polls suggest that Italy’s next leader could be Giorgia Meloni, a far-right leader with post-Fascist roots. She would be the nation’s first female prime minister.

title: Deadlier Than the Titanic: A Ferry Set Out With About 1,900 Aboard. Only 64 Survived.
description: Tourists, vendors, babies, hundreds of university students and a soccer team from Senegal perished in a little-known ferry disaster 20 years ago. Survivors and families of victims still want justice.

title: Exploring ‘The Land of Morning Calm’
description: A traveler gets beyond Seoul’s sprawl to explore tranquil thatched mountain hamlets, peaceful Buddhist temples and unhurried ‘slow food’ towns in rural South Korea.

title: Russia’s Defense Ministry shakes up its leadership.
Zelensky Urges Russian Soldiers to Surrender as Moscow Broadens War
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky spoke in Russian as protests erupted across Russia against President Vladimir V. Putin’s attempts to conscript thousands of new troops.

title: Super Typhoon Noru Heads for Philippines After ‘Explosive’ Surge
description: Forecasters warned of heavy rains and winds that could bring flooding and landslides to densely populated areas of the country.

title: Zelensky calls on Russians to resist Putin’s conscription.
North Korea Launches Ballistic Missile Off Its East Coast
description: The exercise was Pyongyang’s first ballistic missile test in nearly four months and came days after the U.S.S. Ronald Reagan arrived in a South Korean port.

title: The New India: Expanding Influence Abroad, Straining Democracy at Home
description: As India rises, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has faced little pushback as he weaponizes institutions to consolidate power and entrench his Hindu nationalist vision.
